Question: This person acknowledged one illegitimate son: Charles Léon (1806–1881) by Eléonore Denuelle de La Plaigne,.
Hints: This person was born at Ajaccio in Corsica in a family of noble Italian ancestry which had settled Corsica in the 16th century.
The couple had one child, this person Francis Joseph Charles (1811–1832), known from birth as the King of Rome.
This person's father had died of stomach cancer, though this was seemingly unknown at the time of the autopsy.
